title: Richard Herbert of Coldbrook
text:
Sir Richard Herbert (died 1469) of <a href="Abergavenny">Coldbrook Park</a>, near Abergavenny, was a 15th-century <a href="Welsh%20people">Welsh</a> <a href="knight">knight</a>, and the lineal ancestor of the <a href="Baron%20Herbert%20of%20Chirbury">Herberts of Chirbury</a>.
He was the son of <a href="William%20ap%20Thomas">William ap Thomas</a> of <a href="Raglan%20Castle">Raglan Castle</a> and <a href="Gwladys%20ferch%20Dafydd%20Gam">Gwladys ferch Dafydd Gam</a>, and the brother of <a href="William%20Herbert%2C%201st%20Earl%20of%20Pembroke%20%281423%E2%80%931469%29">William Herbert</a>, <a href="Earl%20of%20Pembroke">Earl of Pembroke</a>. He married Margaret, sister of Sir <a href="Rhys%20ap%20Thomas">Rhys ap Thomas</a>. They had two sons: Sir William Herbert of Coldbrook, and Sir Richard Herbert of Powys. His great-grandson, <a href="Edward%20Herbert%2C%201st%20Baron%20Herbert%20of%20Chirbury">Edward Herbert</a>, was raised to the peerage in 1629.
Like many members of the Welsh gentry, Herbert was a notable <a href="bard">bard</a>ic patron. He was the principal patron of <a href="Ieuan%20Deulwyn">Ieuan Deulwyn</a>, and was also a patron of <a href="Guto%27r%20Glyn">Guto'r Glyn</a> as well as others. He hosted a bardic debate at Coldbrook House between Deulwyn and <a href="Bedo%20Brwynllys">Bedo Brwynllys</a>. He was eulogized by Ieuan Deulwyn, Bedo Brwynllys, <a href="Hywel%20Dafi">Hywel Dafi</a>, and (jointly with his brother William) <a href="Huw%20Cae%20Llwyd">Huw Cae Llwyd</a>.
Like his brother, he was a supporter of the <a href="House%20of%20York">House of York</a> during the <a href="Wars%20of%20the%20Roses">Wars of the Roses</a>. He fought alongside his brother at the <a href="Battle%20of%20Edgecote%20Moor">Battle of Edgecote Moor</a> (a <a href="House%20of%20Lancaster">Lancastrian</a> victory), where he was captured and executed. He is interred with his wife at <a href="Priory%20Church%20of%20St%20Mary%2C%20Abergavenny">Abergavenny Priory</a>, near other members of his family.
